title.narrative: The Seed institute talking gardens - seed2015 school gardening and food production

description.narrative: The project is motivated by the need to reduce poverty and food insecurity and the related inability of the affected peasant farmers to acquire sustainable livelihood. 'Poverty hearings' conducted in 2010 identified food insecurity and youth unemployment a s the most pressing development concerns for Kenyans living in rural areas. The government?s MDGs status report provided similar results. Low agriculture productivity is one of the most visible manifestations of rural poverty in Kenya. In pursuit of the ov erall aim of the project the organization has adopted establishment of school gardening and production of food as the basis for agricultural skills and technological transfer to the communities. The project will address problems identified in a consultativ e way with the communities.The action targets small scale farmers who will be reached through 12 local schools. The school garden thus act as a spring board to community learning on new technology policy action and also school curriculum learning. Women wi ll be specifically targeted to learn new skills in soil management climate change adaptation and production for the market. Objective: Create 12 community based innovation and advisory centres designed to support small scale farmers exploit research data in agricultural production particularly research information on improving soil management selection of quality seeds adaptability to climate change and market access. The overall aim of this project is improve the food security and living standards of rur al households in Kenya. The action is therefore conceived as a process, a journey moving the households from poverty to prosperity. Community participation and ownership are the pillars upon which the project is designed. The first year of the project f ocussed on improving soil management selection of quality seeds/animals and adaptability to climate change.Over and above the focus on technological uptake to increase production the action will focus on post harvest diseases and pest control. Amongst othe rs the following diseases and pests will addressed - Aflatoxin control- Control methods in the area of harvest and storage management . - Maize Lethal Necrosis - There is an outbreak of a plague like maize disease in Kenya. - Promote application of a Huma n Rights Based Approach in the governance of the agricultural sector at the local level.
